Articles.Content:
Here is a worried Kerbal who's hoping to get a reaction from his biologically inhibited friend.

A chilly morning on Laythe.

A view of Jool from a polar orbit around Tylo.

A capsule reentering Kerbin's atmosphere.

Edited June 3, 2014 by Felsmak
Looks nice! Love the detail on the capsule and the cone of the reentry particles.

Love it! Maybe you could make the "fire" around the capsule brighter and darker.

I wish I didn't draw like an 8 yo

The little clouds are great, really gives a sense of distance there.

I wish I didn't draw like an 8 yo

It doesn't matter, the only requirement for drawing or other creative arts is that you enjoy what you do, whether you don't have much practice or you feel comfortable with your skills, there will always be someone better than you, so you have nothing to lose and just happiness to gain, every drawing you do gives you more experience for your next one.

Edit* Sorry for being long-winded lol But people are not scared to learn how to read, not scared to learn how to count, people are not scared to learn how to drive, by scared i mean that they don't see these things as insurmountable, art and creativity should be treated just the same, some people are instantly good others are not, but it is possible to learn and to improve, just like in any other skill.

Edited May 11, 2013 by Custard Donut (In Space)

I like that art style, Especially how it looks quite cartoonish until you see the re-entry bit. Also, I don't know how much realism you're going for, but I think some "night sky" could do good in that drawing, BTW, what software do you use for drawings?

I wish I didn't draw like an 8 yo

I do too, but still, give it a shot, it's fun! And don't compare yourself to the wrong people.

My latest attempt at "Art", down in my signature, that's about as good as I can get (FYI that's the Swedish flag in the background)

I suggest trying to desin a flag for KSP, it doesn't have to be too much, it's fun, and it'll come in handy in a moment in game, and it feels good to have one with personal touch. Here's a thread for some insperation

Edited May 11, 2013 by Polar Bear
I love it! It has a very distinct style that looks awesome. Please make more.
This isn't your art!!! I've seen this before, by ANOTHER USER.

This isn't your art!!! I've seen this before, by ANOTHER USER.
I used to have a thread here, but it got decimated during the Oktoberfest...

He probably changed his name in the great Kraken attack.
He joined in May 2012.
"David Westberg" sounds quite Swedish (I know it could be added in later ofc), also, maybe someone stole (Or borrowed with permisson) HIS art.

He joined in May 2012.

Many accounts were deleted.

Hey look:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/19028-Glorious-space-KSP-fanart-by-Unsinn?p=499234

It's Unsinn, just changed his name.

Thanks, everyone! Yeah, I suppose I could rework the plasma trail a little; maybe darken the background to accentuate its brightness even more.

I wish I didn't draw like an 8 yo

I know how you feel. I usually feel quite bad myself whenever I see what some people can do, but truth is there will always be plenty of people ahead of you no matter how far you get, so you might as well keep doing your thing if that's what you enjoy, because that's all that matters.

Also, I don't know how much realism you're going for, but I think some "night sky" could do good in that drawing, BTW, what software do you use for drawings?

I'm using Photoshop, and I decided not to make any night sky because the whole scene is meant to be too bright to allow you to see any. Physics (or whatever) favours the lazy.

This isn't your art!!! I've seen this before, by ANOTHER USER.

It's mine, alright. Like Nutt007 said, I just changed my name shortly after the purge; didn't like my old one.

Edited May 11, 2013 by Felsmak

Whoa, amazin' art style.

Also, who doesn't love re-entry fried Kerbans?

Huh? Eh? Er... Anyone?

Edited May 12, 2013 by ReptilianGameplays

Kerbals fried in coolant liquid. I'm starting to feel hungry.

Anyway, here's a little (barely visible) sketch of my next drawing. I'm sure most will recognize the place.

EDIT: Okay, it might be hard to tell that landscape from that of any other moon. So, here's something better that I made to motivate myself to finish it!

Edited May 12, 2013 by Felsmak

A chilly morning on Laythe. Rocks will haunt my dreams forever.

Edited May 14, 2013 by Felsmak
Really good.
Laythe? It looks beautiful, Really like the detail on Jool too.
Thanks! Yes, that's Laythe. Perhaps a little rockier than the in-game version, hehe.
Very well done. I'll be keeping tabs on this thread for certain.
That's pretty good!

Thanks!

I'll be keeping tabs on this thread for certain.

Looks like I'm finally doing something right, heheh.

*shudder*

A lot of rocks...

They would haunt me in my dreams if I had to draw so many.

And I like your style, subscribed to this thread. My drawings are always out of proportion, but I guess I'd work better on a computer.

This isn't your art!!! I've seen this before, by ANOTHER USER.

You probably saw it on the mega thread i made for reentry before K-day occurred.
Didn't you make one of a view of Jool from a polar orbit of Tylo? I really liked that one and would love to see more like it.
